messages.content:
Can you help me create the cover page for this agreement? I don't like what i have, ti's all centered and doens't seem professional:
Proposal agreement between




Party One: 
WORLD WINDOWS GENERAL CONTRACTING, LTD, CO. 
Mr. Nova Kojaian 

&

ADVANCED PIPELINE SERVICES 
Dr. Falah Mustafa

& 

Party Two:
WATER ENGINEERING TECHNOLOGIES, INC.
Dr. Saad Ghalib


_______________________________________

CONFIDENTIAL

Final Agreement 
_______________________________________


THIS TERM SHEET (the “Term Sheet”) is dated as of 23rd September 2023.
BETWEEN: 
 
The joint venture for the project:  

World Windows General Contracting Ltd. Co (WWGCC)
registered in the Companies Registrar Department / Ministry of Commerce No. 26004 on 2/5/2005.
Advance Pipeline Services, (ADPS)
Registration Number 34126 on 13/04/2021
Address: 21, 56th Street Al Wahdah District 904, Baghdad, Iraq 

Called the First Party within this agreement.

Water Engineering Technologies (WET), a Michigan corporation having its registered office at 2626 Packard Rd Ann Arbor, Michigan 48104. 

Called the Second Party within this agreement.

Each individually referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties".
THE PROJECT: The Medical City wastewater project AND / OR The Zuyut Factory Pump station Wastewater Treatment Plant (WWTP) in Baghdad 
BACKGROUND:

All parties aim to market, bid for, and secure a design/build/operate contract for the Project(s)as outlined in this document.
The Parties are interested in cooperating jointly to leverage the expertise of each individual or the collective expertise on agreed terms.
All references to currency in this Term Sheet are in US dollars.

NOW, THEREFORE, THE PARTIES HAVE AGREED TO THE FOLLOWING TERMS AS STATED IN THIS WRITTEN AGREEMENT. 
Contractual Relationship.  The Parties will provide shared services for The Project using the Second Party’s Treatment Shaft technology.  Both WWTPs average capacity are in the range of 150,000 m3/day.   Parties’ contractual relationship and responsibilities are presented in Exhibit A and B.  The parties signing this agreement will operate in their preferred locality. Specific terms and responsibilities among the parties are detailed in Exhibit C and Exhibit D.

The two parties in this agreement shall do their best to qualify for their participation and display their technical capabilities appropriately to win the projects and use for that purpose their accumulated experience and updated market studies.
Each Party bears its administrative expenses separately, except those directly related to the project after obtaining the contract with the Municipality and as agreed by both parties in this agreement. 
The two parties undertake to spend the amounts obtained through the Municipality (beneficiary entity) and as detailed in the proposal exclusively for the purpose of completing the work on the Project(s) as it is not permissible to spend any amount, whatever its value, on any other project, regardless of its importance, and under any pretext or reason, except with the agreement of the twotow Phree parties. The amounts of funds for the above Pproject(s) shall be received from the Municipality and the process of disbursing the fund will be managed by the First Party or their officially authorized representatives with the approval of the two parties.  The First Party will share with the Second Party on a monthly basis the Project financial balance sheet and projected monthly expendutes. 
Party two will submit a budget for the upcoming tasks to be completed to Party One weather for design, consulting or construction oversite for review. Aany suggestion, proposeded changes or comments should be resolved within one week.  completed within two weeks.  In case of not reaching an agreement approval the decision will be made by arbitration. Party Two will not be responsible for delays over the one week review period.  Payment to be completed as defined in terms of payment. 
The budget submitted for each task (such as design or construction oversite) will provide a brief scope of work and expenseswill include design consultant, other subcontractors and WET staff, once the budget is approved, Party Two will be responsible for the contracting and selection of the team and payments involving hiring of design subcontractors, design and technology related expenditures including staff.  (except in the cases of design and technology related expenditure, then it is a joint decision between the first and second party). 


Approval of submittals including mechanical, electrical, structural, and other submittals that deviate from original design will be the responsibility of the Second Party.
During the preparation of the First Party proposal for this project many assumptions and estimates were made for the lack of available information.  The First Party is advised to add reasonable design and construction contingencies to accommodate any overseen conditions that may affect the actual cost.  
The two parties are obligated to inform each other of any communications received out of context, received from other parties related to the participation, regardless of their type (photocopies or by e-mail). The two parties are also to attend when needed at the headquarters of the Municipality or any other department for the purpose of providing administrative and legal facilities (requirements). 
The two parties have no right to sell the contract (secretly or publicly) to any person, group, or any company, whether (Iraqi, Arab, or foreign) under any reason unless agreed by both parties.
The provisions of this agreement apply to any changes that may occur during the implementation of the project, whether it is deleting or creating paragraphs, stopping work for a specific period, canceling some parts of the project, or withholding advances for a specific period, and they are binding on their application (physically and legally). 
This parties in this agreement participation agreement does not prevent either Party from independently entering separate contractual obligations (in any other projects), and this does not entail any obligations for the other Party. 
In the event of a dispute, the parties to this Agreement will use their best efforts to resolve the dispute amicably. Otherwise, the parties will seek arbitration to resolve the dispute through a three-person dispute review committee independent of the signatory parties to this Agreement. Each party chooses its representative on the dispute review committee, and the two members of the dispute review committee choose the third member of the dispute review committee. If the parties do not agree on the dispute review committee’s recommendation, it will be referred to the competent courts in Baghdad, Iraq, and its decision will be binding on both parties.

PARTY 1 Contributions

As per details found in Exhibit C

PARTY 2 Contributions. 

Offering use of its patented technology and expertise in designing Treatment Shaft technology for the Project. 
Assisting the municipality and the First Party in implementing Treatment Shaft technology.
Completion of the first WWTP project, namely Medical City in Baghdad, with a capacity of 150,000 m3/day within the agreement's term. The same terms and conditions apply for the second potential upcoming project.  and (the second project) (??). 
Provide (concept), preliminary, and final engineering design, to ensure project completion according to the project intent. Specific responsibilities are listed in Exhibit D.
The second party is to provide, during the construction phase, consultant engineers in different disciplines representing the design team to respond to the requirements of the construction team (Party Party) request for clarification, respond to comments and proposed changes related to field conditions.  
Assigning a representative as oversight engineer(s) to oversee construction activities and respond to field conditions that required design team input and to facilitate First Party performance upon their request. Staffing, responsibilities, budget  and communications protocols between the First Party and the Second Party for the oversight engineers will be developed by the Second Party at the beginning of the construction work.  The oversight engineer team will include a full time resident engineer assisted with a specialty discipline engineers as needed and staff from then design engineer.   


Compensation of the Second Party: 

As per this agreement the Second Party will be paid from the project budget / payments as follows:
Royalty fee: Lump sum of 3,000,000 USD, to be paid as follows:
Lump sum of 150,000 USD during the process of the development of the design.
Lump sum of 150,000 USD upon the approval of the final design by an Independent International Consultant commissioned by the Client (commissioning and handover of the project).
Lump Sum payment for the design license fee of $1,000,000 USD to be paid upon completion of the pilot study and before starting the design.
Lump Sum payment of $2,000,000 USD for construction license fee to be paid as part of construction mobilization.
The remaining to be paid prorata to the payments recieved proportional to 150M dollars. Over the course of years - if the first payment is 5 million, then it’s 5/150 = .033 - so for 3,000,000 to be paid prorata it will unlock 99,999 after that payment till the end of the project when the entirety of the 3,000,000 is disbursed. 

Detailed Design: Complete design of the project is budgeted at actual cost. The actual cost will be determined after Second Party selection  the design consultant and WET support staff party and approved by the First party. The Second Party will be responsible for the payments only through the Second Party. An agreement will be signed by both parties with the Design party. The final design budget will include the contracted fee agreed with the design consultant and WET staff support selected by the Second Party and approved by the First Party. Payments will be based on actual terms of payment with the design Consultant and support staff.  Because of the preliminary nature of the design and lack of basic information, any expenses beyond the design budget determined at the beginning of the design work, will be reviewed, approved and paid by the First Party. 
Payment for the time and expenses for the team assisting in the QA/QC and third-party review, and improvement of the design, as needed, will be covered at actual cost.  The team will consist mainly of senior consultants selected by the Second Party who worked on this type of projects.  Disciplines of the team will include but not limited to Process, structural, M/E, instrumentation and control and hydraulics.
The payment of the Construction oversight team will be at actual cost billed by second party and paid by the First Party on a monthly basis .
The Second Party will be paid a18% profit sharing in USD for the above project. 
Profit is calculated as contract value minus direct construction cost including time, material, equipment, financial expenses, taxes, design, Royalty fees, contractor overhead and expenses and any fees related to the project excluding any expenses not related to project costs.
For other future projects the fees and expenses and method of payment will be mutually decided between both parties on a project-by-project basis.   

Payment terms  
Item 4-e profit sharing will be paid upon achieving positive cash flow but with a secured successful end of the project. Profit-sharing payment schedule will be agreed upon by the Parties as such will not effect the cash flow to finish the contract smoothly and successfully
All parties have the right to have access on the accountings periodically. Regular monthly reports will be provided by the accountant to all parties.
Payments in Item 4 (b,c and d ) will be paid on a monthly basis  for the completed works and will include 15% to cover overheads of the Second Party.
Party One will pay for the Pilot Program once the contract is signed, including all construction and material expenes. 
Confidential Information: Recipient of Second Party specific confidential/patented technology information agrees to restrict its use of such information to the purpose of this Agreement and will not permit any other use of the same without the prior written consent of the Second Party.  

Warranties: Both parties warrant the following: 
No ongoing or pending lawsuits to their knowledge that effect their financial and operational capability. 
Neither Party's history includes insolvency, bankruptcy, or criminal charges. 
Each party is liable for his task (as per responsibility chart in exhibit A, C and D)

Further Actions: 

Both Parties will explore the optimal structure for marketing and implementing the Second Party's technology for potential projects for the Municipality of Baghdad. Alliances with third parties may be considered on a case-by-case basis and upon mutual approval by both parties in advance.
This Agreement will be the basis for the final signed Agreement to be drafted in Iraq and notarized by a public notary in Baghdad, Iraq.

Exclusivity: This Agreement is based on exclusive teaming arrangement for the Municipality of Baghdad.  The exclusivity granted in this Agreement is based on First Party availability to perform. Each party has the right to terminate this exclusive teaming arrangement with three months’ written notice.  Exclusive arrangement is not implied or granted in other areas.  Terms and conditions in this Agreement are for the two projects stated in this Agreement.  Any future work will be negotiated on a project-by-project basis.  Participation of other partners may be considered depending on the need for such partnership.  Each party will be responsible for their expenses for marketing and presentations.

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement of the Parties and supersedes any prior written or oral agreements between them relating to the Information; may only be amended by a written document duly signed by the Parties; and shall be binding upon the successors and assigns of each of the Parties.

The Parties representatives signing this agreement each has the full authority to enter into this Agreement and to disclose the Information.

Indemnification:

Each Party agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the other Party and their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, and representatives from and against any claims, demands, suits, actions, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorney's fees) arising out of or in connection with any breach of this Term Sheet, any act or omission by the indemnifying Party, or any infringement of intellectual property rights. This indemnification shall survive the termination of this agreement.
Second Party liability is limited to the design of the project including error and omission (E&O) causing failure to achieve the project objectives and meeting regular design practice and standards.  Second Party is not liable for First Party not following the design plans and specifications or deviating from standard construction practices weather or not being identified or notified by the Second  Party’s Oversite team or the design consultant. ?






   Duration: 
Activation of this Agreement starts upon the singing the first contract with the Municipality for either of the referenced projects above.   Duration of this Agreement is for the duration of the project and terminates upon final completion of construction.  


IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the date stated below. 


_____________________________
SIGNED BY 

_____________________________
SIGNED BY 

_____________________________
SIGNED BY.































Contract prorate eacnds when construction ends

Cotract duration, Start at signinig a contreact with the city, ends at end of construction
prorata = fund received divided total contract value

 EXHIBIT A – Responsibility Matrix




















EXHIBIT B – Party Contractual Relationship



























EXHIBIT C – First Party Responsibilities


Scope of Services.  Complete the construction of the project described in the design-build contract between the client and first party and according to the plans and specifications developed as part of the design provided by the Second Party.
One 150,000 m3/d average flow wastewater treatment plant at the Medical City and or Zuit Factory outfall location.
Liquid phase only with solids to be transported off site.
Discharge of disinfected effluent to Tigris River during wet weather conditions (combined sewer overflow).

Outline of Services.
Project management 
Recruitment of all type of manpower needed for the project including all subcontractors 
Enter contract with the municipality of Baghdad for the design build of the project.?
Provide labor and construction equipment appropriate for the scope of work and size of the project.
Purchase project equipment per plans and specifications.
Perform land survey, geotechnical investigation, sewer survey per design consultant request.
Collect information from the municipality to support the design which includes but not limited to pump station flow data, influent water quality, property ownership and boundary delineation, permit and approval requirements, other information needed by the design engineer.  
Perform on site Column Test as specified by the Second Party. Data from the Column Test will be shared with the Second Party and the design consultant.  
Share post construction data monitoring test results with the Second Party and the design consultant to assess performance.
Arrange financing to the project at cost.
Apply QA/Qc and health and safety procedures at site.















EXHIBIT D – Second Party Responsibilities

Scope of Services.  Professional engineering support services related to Treatment Shaft wastewater treatment facility design and construction observation as part of a design-build contract Between (First party and The Client).  The scope of work is as follows:
150,000 m3/d average flow wastewater treatment plant at the Medical City and or Zuit Factory outfall location
Treatment plant to incorporate specified technology and any future modifications as stated in this agreement.
Liquid phase only with solids to be transported off site.
Discharge of disinfected effluent to Tigris River during wet weather conditions (combined sewer overflow).

Outline of Services.
Assessing qualifications, interviewing and final selection of a design engineering consultant.
Coordinate and work directly with the design consultant and ensure critical design criteria and information are communicated to the design consultant and implemented in the design.
Assist First Party in establishment of permitting requirements.
Coordinate between design consultant and First Party to complete land survey,  
soils exploration, identify utility location and define property limits available for the project.
Preliminary design/layout - with Owner input and acceptance.
Budget and cost tracking of design consultant and managing any change orders or additional services required by the team.
Oversee and manage design consultant including work progress, developing design details, provide input to consultant on timely basis and monitor compliance of the design with the project design criteria and performance expectations. 
Assist First Party in final selection of equipment and construction procedures.
Provide construction observation by qualified staff including civil and E/M. Full or part time resident engineer supported with others including other specialized disciplines (QA/QC) depending on work progress and demand.  The First Party will provide furnished site trailer or office with electricity, internet, and other supplies to oversight engineers.
Timely response to field conditions that require design consultant’s input.
Review supplier submittals and assist in addressing requests for information.
Review shop drawings and as built drawings prepared by the First Party.
Participation in First Party production of O&M manual.
The Second Party has no defined role or budget during the first year of operation if offered by the First Party.  If the First Party requests Second Party contribution, Second Party scope and budget will be determined at that time and submitted to the First Party for approval prior to commencing the work.   

Client’s Representative.  The Client (the Municipality) shall designate a representative capable responding to day to day activities and communication., changing orders and similar documents.  The Second Party will assist the First Party in responding to client representative’s comments and request for information.
Performance.  The Second Party shall exercise the normal standard of care and diligence in performing the professional services explicitly described in this agreement as normally employed by other professionals performing the same or similar services, 
Subcontractors.  The Second Party will engage subconsultants and other specialized engineers to perform a portion of the services to be provided by the Second Party.
Cost Estimates.  Since the Second Party has no control over the cost of labor and materials and/or market conditions, any estimates of equipment, construction or operating costs will be made based on the Second Party experience, but the Second Party does not warrant the accuracy of such estimates as compared to contractors’ bids or the First Party incurred.
Underground Structures or Utilities.  In the performance of its services, The Second Party will take reasonable care and precautions to avoid damage to underground structures or utilities.  The First Pary agrees to indemnify, protect, and hold harmless the Second Party from and against all liability, claims, demands, losses, expenses and costs (including attorney’s fees) for and damage to or consequential loss from damage to any underground structures or utilities which are not called to The Second Party’s attention or which are not currently shown on plans furnished to the Second Party.

Site Conditions.  The First Party recognizes that the presence of hazardous materials or pollution on or beneath the surface of a site may create risks and liabilities.  The Second Party has neither created nor contributed to this pollution.  Consequently, the First Party recognizes and hereby acknowledges that the First Party will accordingly limit the Second Party’s liability.?
Shop Drawings.  If shop drawing review is provided, The Second Party will check and review samples, catalog data, schedules, shop drawings, laboratory, shop and mill tests of materials and equipment, and all other data which the First Party is required to submit, only for conformance with the design concept of the Project and compliance with the information given by the construction Contract Documents.
Documents.  All project documents, drawings, files, working papers or other materials, whether written or electronic, prepared, or furnished to the First Party by Second Party are intended for the specific purposes of this project only.  Any reuse of said documents, drawings, files, working papers or other materials after they have left the custody of the Second Party shall be at the user’s sole risk without liability to, or cause of action against, the Second Party.
Construction Phase Services.  The Second Party will provide construction observation or oversite services as part of this Agreement. The Second Party has no liability regarding the compliance of the First Party construction according to Construction Documents prepared by the Second Party.
Third Party Rights.  The Second Party will not confer any rights or benefits under this Agreement to parties other than the First Party and the Second Party.
---End of Agreement—---


Addendum for edits:
These are all the areas where decision making is refenced: 
Joint Decision-Making in Expenditures
Sentence: "The two parties undertake to spend the amounts obtained through the Municipality (beneficiary entity) and as detailed in the proposal exclusively for the purpose of completing the work on the Project as it is not permissible to spend any amount, whatever its value, on any other project, regardless of its importance, and under any pretext or reason, except with the agreement of the three parties."
Context: This clause addresses how financial decisions regarding project funds should be made jointly by the parties.
Approval of Design and Technological Expenditures
Sentence: "The amounts of funds for the above project shall be received from the Municipality and the process of disbursing the fund is limited to the First Party only or their officially authorized representatives, (except in the cases of design and technology related expenditure, then it is a joint decision between the first and second party)."
Context: This specifies that while the First Party primarily manages fund disbursement, decisions related to design and technology expenditures require joint agreement.
Approval of Submittals Deviating from Original Design
Sentence: "Approval of submittals including mechanical, electrical, structural, and other submittals that deviate from original design will be the responsibility of the Second Party."
Context: Indicates that the Second Party has decision-making authority over submittals that deviate from the initial design.
Consultant Engineer Recruitment
Sentence: "The second party is obliged to provide consultant engineers in different disciplines representing the design team to respond to the requirements of the construction team (First Party) (Both parties shall decide on the recruitment and commissioning of design team including all required disciplines)."
Context: This section involves both parties in the decision-making process for recruiting and commissioning consultant engineers for the design team.
Design Consultant Selection
Sentence: "The actual cost will be determined after selecting the design consultant which will be selected by second party and approved by first party."
Context: Refers to the decision-making process for selecting a design consultant, where the Second Party chooses and the First Party approves.

To elevate the cover page of the proposal agreement to a professional level, consider a clean, aligned layout with clear hierarchy. Here's a layout suggestion:

---

**[Top of the Page: Centered]**
[Your Company Logo or Project Symbol, if any]

**[Centered in Bold]**
PROPOSAL AGREEMENT

**[Centered below Title]**
Confidential | Final Agreement

---

**[Left-aligned]**
Date: 23rd September 2023

---

**[Left-aligned]**
Between:

**World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co.**  
Mr. Nova Kojaian

**Advanced Pipeline Services**  
Dr. Falah Mustafa

**[and, centered between the parties]**

**Water Engineering Technologies, Inc.**  
Dr. Saad Ghalib

---

**[Centered]**
Joint Venture Project:  
The Medical City Wastewater Project and/or  
Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant

**[Left-aligned below the project name]**
Background, Purpose, and Terms as detailed within.

---

**[Bottom of the Page: Centered]**
[Company or Project Seal or Signature Lines as needed]

---

Use high-quality paper and a professional font like Times New Roman or Arial. Ensure the logo, if included, is high resolution. Consider legal requirements for official documents and adjust the design accordingly. This layout provides a clear, authoritative presentation, enhancing the document's professional appearance.
should i say proposal agreement at the top or use the words joint venture project / and or etc part? it seems weird to call it a proposal agreemnt only

For a more precise and professional impression, consider titling the document with specific reference to its nature and contents. Here's an adjusted suggestion:

---

**[Top of the Page: Centered]**
[Your Company Logo or Project Symbol, if any]

**[Centered in Bold]**
JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT FOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT

**[Centered below Title]**
Confidential | Final Agreement

---

**[Left-aligned]**
Date: 23rd September 2023

---

**[Left-aligned]**
Between:

**World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co.**  
Mr. Nova Kojaian

**Advanced Pipeline Services**  
Dr. Falah Mustafa

**[and, centered between the parties]**

**Water Engineering Technologies, Inc.**  
Dr. Saad Ghalib

---

**[Centered]**
Projects:

**The Medical City Wastewater Project AND/OR  
Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant**

**[Left-aligned below the project name]**
Comprehensive details, terms, and conditions as stipulated in the agreement.

---

**[Bottom of the Page: Centered]**
[Company or Project Seal or Signature Lines as needed]

---

This title directly reflects the document's purpose as a formal agreement for a specific joint venture project, while maintaining a professional and clear layout. The "AND/OR" specifies the potential scope without ambiguity, and the rest of the document should outline the specifics, obligations, and terms agreed upon by all parties.

what does: [and, centered between the parties]
mean?

The phrase "[and, centered between the parties]" in the layout suggestion is a bit unclear. My apologies for that. It was intended to indicate where "AND" should be placed between the names of the parties involved, signifying their partnership in the agreement. However, it's best to keep it simple and straightforward. Here's how it can be presented more clearly:

---

**[Left-aligned]**
Between:

**World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co.**  
Mr. Nova Kojaian

AND

**Advanced Pipeline Services**  
Dr. Falah Mustafa

AND

**Water Engineering Technologies, Inc.**  
Dr. Saad Ghalib

---

In this layout, "AND" is clearly placed on its own line between the parties involved, indicating that all listed entities are jointly entering the agreement. This approach removes any ambiguity from the previous instruction.
falah and nova are working togehter as party 1

Understood. To correctly represent the collaboration between Falah and Nova as Party One in the joint venture, the layout should group them together, differentiating from Party Two. Here's the revised format:

---

**[Top of the Page: Centered]**
[Your Company Logo or Project Symbol, if any]

**[Centered in Bold]**
JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT FOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT

**[Centered below Title]**
Confidential | Final Agreement

---

**[Left-aligned]**
Date: 23rd September 2023

---

**[Left-aligned]**
Between:

**Party One:**  
World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co.  
Mr. Nova Kojaian  
&  
Advanced Pipeline Services  
Dr. Falah Mustafa  

**AND**

**Party Two:**  
Water Engineering Technologies, Inc.  
Dr. Saad Ghalib

---

**[Centered]**
Projects:

**The Medical City Wastewater Project AND/OR  
Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant**

**[Left-aligned below the project name]**
Comprehensive details, terms, and conditions as stipulated in the agreement.

---

**[Bottom of the Page: Centered]**
[Company or Project Seal or Signature Lines as needed]

---

This layout clearly distinguishes between the two parties involved in the agreement, with Party One being a collaboration between World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co (represented by Mr. Nova Kojaian) and Advanced Pipeline Services (represented by Dr. Falah Mustafa), and Party Two being Water Engineering Technologies, Inc. (represented by Dr. Saad Ghalib).
should i add the word below here? Comprehensive details, terms, and conditions as stipulated in the agreement below.

Yes, adding the word "below" clarifies that the comprehensive details, terms, and conditions are to be found in the subsequent sections of the document. Here's how you can incorporate it:

---

**[Centered]**
Projects:

**The Medical City Wastewater Project AND/OR  
Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant**

**[Left-aligned below the project name]**
Comprehensive details, terms, and conditions as stipulated in the agreement below.

---

This ensures the reader understands that the detailed agreement follows immediately after this introductory cover page.

How is this? JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT FOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT  

Confidential | Final Agreement

Date: 23rd September 2023  

Between:

Party One
World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co.
Represented by Mr. Nova Kojaian
& 
Advanced Pipeline Services
Represented by Dr. Falah Mustafa

AND

Party Two
Water Engineering Technologies, Inc.
Represented by Dr. Saad Ghalib


Projects:

The Medical City Wastewater Project 
AND/OR 
The Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant

The structure you've provided is clear and well-organized. Using "Represented by" adds a formal touch that clearly indicates the individuals acting on behalf of their respective organizations. Here are a few minor suggestions for refinement:

1. **Alignment and Spacing**: Ensure consistent alignment and spacing throughout the document for a polished look.
2. **Project Names**: Ensure the project names are accurate and perhaps bolded for emphasis.
3. **"AND/OR" Usage**: Ensure this is the intended choice, as it implies either or both projects could be included in the agreement.

Here's how it might look with these considerations:

---

**JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT FOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT**

**Confidential | Final Agreement**

**Date**: 23rd September 2023

---

**Between:**

**Party One**  
World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co.  
Represented by Mr. Nova Kojaian  
&  
Advanced Pipeline Services  
Represented by Dr. Falah Mustafa  

**AND**

**Party Two**  
Water Engineering Technologies, Inc.  
Represented by Dr. Saad Ghalib

---

**Projects:**

**The Medical City Wastewater Project**  
AND/OR  
**The Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant**

---

This layout maintains a professional and authoritative tone while clearly delineating the parties and the scope of the project(s). It's good practice to review the final document for consistency in formatting, such as font size and style, to ensure a polished and professional appearance.
which parts should be centered?

In a formal document like a Joint Venture Agreement, typically the title, subtitle (if any), and section headings are centered to give it a structured and professional appearance. Here's how you might center the parts:

1. **Title**: "JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT FOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT" - Centered to emphasize the document's primary purpose.
2. **Subtitle**: "Confidential | Final Agreement" - Centered directly below the title for immediate visibility.
3. **Date**: Often left-aligned, but can be centered for stylistic consistency.
4. **Between**: Centered as a section heading.
5. **Party One, Party Two**: Left-aligned under their respective "Between" section for clarity.
6. **Projects**: Centered as a section heading.
7. **Project Names**: Centered to highlight the specific projects involved in the agreement.

Here's how the centered elements would look:

---

**[Centered]**
JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT FOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT

**[Centered]**
Confidential | Final Agreement

**[Centered]**
Date: 23rd September 2023

---

**[Centered]**
Between:

**[Left-aligned]**
Party One  
World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co.  
Represented by Mr. Nova Kojaian  
&  
Advanced Pipeline Services  
Represented by Dr. Falah Mustafa  

**[Left-aligned]**
AND

**[Left-aligned]**
Party Two  
Water Engineering Technologies, Inc.  
Represented by Dr. Saad Ghalib

---

**[Centered]**
Projects:

**[Centered]**
The Medical City Wastewater Project  
AND/OR  
The Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant

---

This format uses centered text to draw attention to the main elements and sections of the document, while the details under each section are left-aligned to maintain readability and organization.

language doesn't seem legalprofessional can you help: BACKGROUND:

All parties aim to market, bid for, and secure a design/build/operate contract for the Project(s)as outlined in this document.
The Parties are interested in cooperating jointly to leverage the expertise of each individual or the collective expertise on agreed terms.
All references to currency in this Term Sheet are in US dollars.

NOW, THEREFORE, THE PARTIES HAVE AGREED TO THE FOLLOWING TERMS AS STATED IN THIS WRITTEN AGREEMENT.

To provide a more formal and legally professional tone to the BACKGROUND section and the introduction of terms, consider the following revision:

---

**BACKGROUND:**

JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT FOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT
Confidential | Final Agreement
THIS TERM SHEET (the “Term Sheet”) is dated 23rd December, 2023.


BETWEEN: 

Party One:
World Windows General Contracting, Ltd. Co. Registration in the Companies Registrar Department / Ministry of Commerce in Iraq No. 26004 on 2/5/2005.
Represented by: Mr. Nova Kojaian

AND 

Advance Pipeline Services, (ADPS). Registration in the Companies Registrar Department / Ministry of Commerce in Iraq No. 34126 on 13/04/2021
Address: 21, 56th Street Al Wahdah District 904, Baghdad, Iraq 
Represented by: Dr. Falah Mustafa

AND

Party Two: 
Water Engineering Technologies, LLC. Entity ID at the Corporations Division in Michigan: 801785495
Address: 2626 Packard Rd Ann Arbor MI 48104 USA
Represented by: Dr. Saad Ghalib


THE PROJECT(S):
The Medical City Wastewater Project
AND/OR
The Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant


Each individually referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties".


BACKGROUND:
1. Contractual Relationship.
Dispute Resolution:
PARTY 1 Contributions
PARTY 2 Contributions.
BACKGROUND:

All parties aim to market, bid for, and secure a design/build/operate contract for the Project(s)as outlined in this document.
The Parties intend to cooperate by leveraging the individual and collective expertise in accordance with the agreed terms.
All references to currency in this Term Sheet are in US dollars.

NOW, THEREFORE, THE PARTIES AGREE TO THE FOLLOWING TERMS AS STATED IN THIS WRITTEN AGREEMENT. 
Contractual Relationship.  
The Parties will provide shared services for The Project(s) using the Second Party’s Treatment Shaft technology.  Both WasteWater Treatment Plants (WWTPs) average capacity are in the range of 150,000 m3/day.  

The Parties’ contractual relationship and responsibilities are presented in Exhibit A and B.  The parties signing this agreement will operate in their preferred locality. Specific terms and responsibilities among the parties are detailed in Exhibit C and Exhibit D.

The two parties in this agreement shall do their best to qualify for their participation and display their technical capabilities appropriately to win the projects and use for that purpose their accumulated experience and updated market studies.
Each Party bears its administrative expenses separately, except those directly related to the project after obtaining the contract with the Municipality and as agreed by both parties in this agreement. 
The two parties undertake to spend the amounts obtained through the Municipality (beneficiary entity) and as detailed in the proposal exclusively for the purpose of completing the work on the Project(s) as it is not permissible to spend any amount, whatever its value, on any other project, regardless of its importance, and under any pretext or reason, except with the agreement of the two Parties. The amounts of funds for the above Project(s) shall be received from the Municipality and the process of disbursing the funds will be managed by the First Party or their officially authorized representatives with the approval of the two parties as defined in the decision making process below. 
Party two will submit a budget for design and construction oversight to Party One whether. Any suggestion, proposed changes or comments should be resolved within five business days. In the case an agreement is not reached in that time, the decision will be made by arbitration, as defined below. Party Two will not be responsible for delays over the one week review period.  Payment to be completed as defined in terms of payment. 
The budget submitted for each task (such as design or construction oversight) will provide a brief scope of work, expenses, bills for design consultants and other subcontractors / WET staff. Once the budget is approved, Party Two will be responsible for the contracting and selection of the team and payments involving hiring of design subcontractors, design and technology related expenditures including staff.
Approval of submittals including mechanical, electrical, structural, and other submittals that deviate from original design will be the responsibility of the Second Party.
The two parties are obligated to inform each other of any communications received out of context, received from other parties related to the participation, regardless of their type (photocopies or by email). The two parties are also to attend when needed at the headquarters of the Municipality or any other department for the purpose of providing administrative and legal facilities (requirements). 
The two parties have no right to sell the contract (secretly or publicly) to any person, group, or any company, whether (Iraqi, Arab, or foreign) under any reason unless agreed by both parties.
The provisions of this agreement apply to any changes that may occur during the implementation of the project(s).
The Partys’ participation in this agreement does not prevent either Party from independently entering separate contractual obligations in any other projects, and this does not entail any obligations for the other Party. 
Dispute Resolution: 
In the event of a dispute, the parties to this Agreement will use their best efforts to resolve the dispute amicably. Otherwise, the parties will seek arbitration to resolve the dispute through a three-person dispute review committee independent of the signatory parties to this Agreement. Each party chooses its representative on the dispute review committee, and the two members of the dispute review committee choose the third member of the dispute review committee. If the parties do not agree on the dispute review committee’s recommendation, it will be referred to the competent courts in Baghdad, Iraq, and its decision will be binding on both parties.

PARTY 1 Contributions

As per details found in Exhibit C

PARTY 2 Contributions. 

Offering use of its patented technology and expertise in designing Treatment Shaft technology for the Project. 
Assisting the municipality and the First Party in implementing Treatment Shaft technology.
Completion of the first WWTP project, namely Medical City in Baghdad, with a capacity of 150,000 m3/day within the agreement's term. The same terms and conditions apply for the second potential upcoming project.  and (the second project) (??). 
Provide (concept), preliminary, and final engineering design, to ensure project completion according to the project intent. Specific responsibilities are listed in Exhibit D.
The second party is to provide, during the construction phase, consultant engineers in different disciplines representing the design team to respond to the requirements of the construction team (Party Party) request for clarification, respond to comments and proposed changes related to field conditions.  
Assigning a representative as oversight engineer(s) to oversee construction activities and respond to field conditions that required design team input and to facilitate First Party performance upon their request. Staffing, responsibilities, budget  and communications protocols between the First Party and the Second Party for the oversight engineers will be developed by the Second Party at the beginning of the construction work.  The oversight engineer team will include a full time resident engineer assisted with a specialty discipline engineers as needed and staff from then design engineer.   


4. Compensation of the Second Party: 

As per this agreement the Second Party will be paid from the project budget / payments as follows:

Royalty fee: Lump sum of 3,000,000 USD, to be paid as follows:
Lump sum of 150,000 USD during the process of the development of the design.
Lump sum of 150,000 USD upon the approval of the final design by an Independent International Consultant commissioned by the Client (commissioning and handover of the project).
Lump Sum payment for the design license fee of $1,000,000 USD to be paid upon completion of the pilot study and before starting the design.
Lump Sum payment of $2,000,000 USD for construction license fee to be paid as part of construction mobilization.
Any remaining balance shall be paid on a pro-rata basis, corresponding proportionally to the total contract value, as payments are received by Party One throughout the term of this agreement, as further detailed in the Definitions section herein. By way of illustration, should Party One receive a payment of 5 million USD, representing 3.33% of a total 150 million USD contract value, an equivalent 3.33% of the remaining balance shall be disbursed, continuing in this manner until the full balance is settled by the conclusion of the agreement term."

Detailed Design: Complete design of the project is budgeted at actual cost. The actual cost will be determined after Second Party selection  the design consultant and WET support staff party and approved by the First party. The Second Party will be responsible for the payments only through the Second Party. An agreement will be signed by both parties with the Design party. The final design budget will include the contracted fee agreed with the design consultant and WET staff support selected by the Second Party and approved by the First Party. Payments will be based on actual terms of payment with the design Consultant and support staff.  Because of the preliminary nature of the design and lack of basic information, any expenses beyond the design budget determined at the beginning of the design work, will be reviewed, approved and paid by the First Party. 
Payment for the time and expenses for the team assisting in the QA/QC and third-party review, and improvement of the design, as needed, will be covered at actual cost.  The team will consist mainly of senior consultants selected by the Second Party who worked on this type of projects.  Disciplines of the team will include but not limited to Process, structural, M/E, instrumentation and control and hydraulics.
The payment of the Construction oversight team will be at actual cost billed by the second party and paid by the First Party on a monthly basis .
The Second Party will be paid a18% profit sharing in USD for the above project. 
Profit is calculated as contract value minus direct construction cost including time, material, equipment, financial expenses, taxes, design, Royalty fees, contractor overhead and expenses and any fees related to the project excluding any expenses not related to project costs.
For other future projects the fees and expenses and method of payment will be mutually decided between both parties on a project-by-project basis.   

5. Payment terms  
Item 4-e profit sharing will be paid upon achieving positive cash flow but with a secured successful end of the project. Profit-sharing payment schedule will be agreed upon by the Parties as such will not effect the cash flow to finish the contract smoothly and successfully
All parties have the right to have access on the accountings periodically. Regular monthly reports will be provided by the accountant to all parties.
Payments in Item 4 (b,c and d ) will be paid on a monthly basis  for the completed works and will include 15% to cover overheads of the Second Party.
Party One will pay for the Pilot Program once the contract is signed, including all construction and material expenses. 

6. Confidential Information: 

Recipient of Second Party specific confidential/patented technology information agrees to restrict its use of such information to the purpose of this Agreement and will not permit any other use of the same without the prior written consent of the Second Party.  

7. Warranties: 
Both parties warrant the following: 
No ongoing or pending lawsuits to their knowledge that effect their financial and operational capability. 
Neither Party's history includes insolvency, bankruptcy, or criminal charges. 
Each party is liable for his task (as per responsibility chart in exhibit A, C and D)

8. Further Actions: 

Both Parties will explore the optimal structure for marketing and implementing the Second Party's technology for potential projects for the Municipality of Baghdad. Alliances with third parties may be considered on a case-by-case basis and upon mutual approval by both parties in advance.
This Agreement will be the basis for the final signed Agreement to be drafted in Iraq and notarized by a public notary in Baghdad, Iraq.

9. Exclusivity 
This Agreement is based on an exclusive teaming arrangement for the Municipality of Baghdad.  The exclusivity granted in this Agreement is based on First Party availability to perform. Each party has the right to terminate this exclusive teaming arrangement with three months’ written notice.  Exclusive arrangement is not implied or granted in other areas.  Terms and conditions in this Agreement are for the two projects stated in this Agreement.  Any future work will be negotiated on a project-by-project basis.  Participation of other partners may be considered depending on the need for such partnership.  Each party will be responsible for their expenses for marketing and presentations.

10. Comprehensiveness 
This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement of the Parties and supersedes any prior written or oral agreements between them relating to the Information; may only be amended by a written document duly signed by the Parties; and shall be binding upon the successors and assigns of each of the Parties.

11. Authority 
The Parties representatives signing this agreement each has the full authority to enter into this Agreement and to disclose the Information.

12. Indemnification:

Each Party agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the other Party and their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, and representatives from and against any claims, demands, suits, actions, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorney's fees) arising out of or in connection with any breach of this Term Sheet, any act or omission by the indemnifying Party, or any infringement of intellectual property rights. This indemnification shall survive the termination of this agreement.
Second Party liability is limited to the design of the project including error and omission (E&O) causing failure to achieve the project objectives and meeting regular design practice and standards.  Second Party is not liable for First Party not following the design plans and specifications or deviating from standard construction practices weather or not being identified or notified by the Second  Party’s Oversite team or the design consultant. ?

13 Duration. 
Activation of this Agreement starts upon the singing the first contract with the Municipality for either of the referenced projects above.   Duration of this Agreement is for the duration of the project and terminates upon final completion of construction.  


IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the date stated below.

 EXHIBIT A – Responsibility Matrix




















EXHIBIT B – Party Contractual Relationship



























EXHIBIT C – First Party Responsibilities


Scope of Services.  Complete the construction of the project described in the design-build contract between the client and first party and according to the plans and specifications developed as part of the design provided by the Second Party.
One 150,000 m3/d average flow wastewater treatment plant at the Medical City and or Zuit Factory outfall location.
Liquid phase only with solids to be transported off site.
Discharge of disinfected effluent to Tigris River during wet weather conditions (combined sewer overflow).

Outline of Services.
Project management 
Recruitment of all type of manpower needed for the project including all subcontractors 
Enter contract with the municipality of Baghdad for the design build of the project.?
Provide labor and construction equipment appropriate for the scope of work and size of the project.
Purchase project equipment per plans and specifications.
Perform land survey, geotechnical investigation, sewer survey per design consultant request.
Collect information from the municipality to support the design which includes but not limited to pump station flow data, influent water quality, property ownership and boundary delineation, permit and approval requirements, other information needed by the design engineer.  
Perform on site Column Test as specified by the Second Party. Data from the Column Test will be shared with the Second Party and the design consultant.  
Share post construction data monitoring test results with the Second Party and the design consultant to assess performance.
Arrange financing to the project at cost.
Apply QA/Qc and health and safety procedures at site.















EXHIBIT D – Second Party Responsibilities

Scope of Services.  Professional engineering support services related to Treatment Shaft wastewater treatment facility design and construction observation as part of a design-build contract Between (First party and The Client).  The scope of work is as follows:
150,000 m3/d average flow wastewater treatment plant at the Medical City and or Zuit Factory outfall location
Treatment plant to incorporate specified technology and any future modifications as stated in this agreement.
Liquid phase only with solids to be transported off site.
Discharge of disinfected effluent to Tigris River during wet weather conditions (combined sewer overflow).

Outline of Services.
Assessing qualifications, interviewing and final selection of a design engineering consultant.
Coordinate and work directly with the design consultant and ensure critical design criteria and information are communicated to the design consultant and implemented in the design.
Assist First Party in establishment of permitting requirements.
Coordinate between design consultant and First Party to complete land survey,  
soils exploration, identify utility location and define property limits available for the project.
Preliminary design/layout - with Owner input and acceptance.
Budget and cost tracking of design consultant and managing any change orders or additional services required by the team.
Oversee and manage design consultant including work progress, developing design details, provide input to consultant on timely basis and monitor compliance of the design with the project design criteria and performance expectations. 
Assist First Party in final selection of equipment and construction procedures.
Provide construction observation by qualified staff including civil and E/M. Full or part time resident engineer supported with others including other specialized disciplines (QA/QC) depending on work progress and demand.  The First Party will provide furnished site trailer or office with electricity, internet, and other supplies to oversight engineers.
Timely response to field conditions that require design consultant’s input.
Review supplier submittals and assist in addressing requests for information.
Review shop drawings and as built drawings prepared by the First Party.
Participation in First Party production of O&M manual.
The Second Party has no defined role or budget during the first year of operation if offered by the First Party.  If the First Party requests Second Party contribution, Second Party scope and budget will be determined at that time and submitted to the First Party for approval prior to commencing the work.   

Client’s Representative.  The Client (the Municipality) shall designate a representative capable responding to day to day activities and communication., changing orders and similar documents.  The Second Party will assist the First Party in responding to client representative’s comments and request for information.
Performance.  The Second Party shall exercise the normal standard of care and diligence in performing the professional services explicitly described in this agreement as normally employed by other professionals performing the same or similar services, 
Subcontractors.  The Second Party will engage subconsultants and other specialized engineers to perform a portion of the services to be provided by the Second Party.
Cost Estimates.  Since the Second Party has no control over the cost of labor and materials and/or market conditions, any estimates of equipment, construction or operating costs will be made based on the Second Party experience, but the Second Party does not warrant the accuracy of such estimates as compared to contractors’ bids or the First Party incurred.
Underground Structures or Utilities.  In the performance of its services, The Second Party will take reasonable care and precautions to avoid damage to underground structures or utilities.  The First Pary agrees to indemnify, protect, and hold harmless the Second Party from and against all liability, claims, demands, losses, expenses and costs (including attorney’s fees) for and damage to or consequential loss from damage to any underground structures or utilities which are not called to The Second Party’s attention or which are not currently shown on plans furnished to the Second Party.

Site Conditions.  The First Party recognizes that the presence of hazardous materials or pollution on or beneath the surface of a site may create risks and liabilities.  The Second Party has neither created nor contributed to this pollution.  Consequently, the First Party recognizes and hereby acknowledges that the First Party will accordingly limit the Second Party’s liability.?
Shop Drawings.  If shop drawing review is provided, The Second Party will check and review samples, catalog data, schedules, shop drawings, laboratory, shop and mill tests of materials and equipment, and all other data which the First Party is required to submit, only for conformance with the design concept of the Project and compliance with the information given by the construction Contract Documents.
Documents.  All project documents, drawings, files, working papers or other materials, whether written or electronic, prepared, or furnished to the First Party by Second Party are intended for the specific purposes of this project only.  Any reuse of said documents, drawings, files, working papers or other materials after they have left the custody of the Second Party shall be at the user’s sole risk without liability to, or cause of action against, the Second Party.
Construction Phase Services.  The Second Party will provide construction observation or oversite services as part of this Agreement. The Second Party has no liability regarding the compliance of the First Party construction according to Construction Documents prepared by the Second Party.
Third Party Rights.  The Second Party will not confer any rights or benefits under this Agreement to parties other than the First Party and the Second Party.
---End of Agreement—---


Addendum for edits:
These are all the areas where decision making is refenced: 
Joint Decision-Making in Expenditures
Sentence: "The two parties undertake to spend the amounts obtained through the Municipality (beneficiary entity) and as detailed in the proposal exclusively for the purpose of completing the work on the Project as it is not permissible to spend any amount, whatever its value, on any other project, regardless of its importance, and under any pretext or reason, except with the agreement of the three parties."
Context: This clause addresses how financial decisions regarding project funds should be made jointly by the parties.
Approval of Design and Technological Expenditures
Sentence: "The amounts of funds for the above project shall be received from the Municipality and the process of disbursing the fund is limited to the First Party only or their officially authorized representatives, (except in the cases of design and technology related expenditure, then it is a joint decision between the first and second party)."
Context: This specifies that while the First Party primarily manages fund disbursement, decisions related to design and technology expenditures require joint agreement.
Approval of Submittals Deviating from Original Design
Sentence: "Approval of submittals including mechanical, electrical, structural, and other submittals that deviate from original design will be the responsibility of the Second Party."
Context: Indicates that the Second Party has decision-making authority over submittals that deviate from the initial design.
Consultant Engineer Recruitment
Sentence: "The second party is obliged to provide consultant engineers in different disciplines representing the design team to respond to the requirements of the construction team (First Party) (Both parties shall decide on the recruitment and commissioning of design team including all required disciplines)."
Context: This section involves both parties in the decision-making process for recruiting and commissioning consultant engineers for the design team.
Design Consultant Selection
Sentence: "The actual cost will be determined after selecting the design consultant which will be selected by second party and approved by first party."
Context: Refers to the decision-making process for selecting a design consultant, where the Second Party chooses and the First Party approves.

Creating a glossary for your agreement is a wise move to ensure clarity and understanding of terms for all parties involved. Here's a simplified and essential glossary based on key terms and concepts that might lead to confusion or misunderstanding, including "Agreement Duration" and other relevant terms:

### Glossary:

1. **Agreement Duration**: The total time period for which the Agreement is valid, starting from the date of signing the first contract with the Municipality for either of the referenced projects and ending upon the final completion of construction.

2. **Pro-rata**: A method of allocating individual amounts proportionally based on the total contract value or other specified metrics. In the context of payments, it refers to distributing funds proportionally as milestones or payment triggers are met.

3. **Term Sheet**: The initial section of the agreement outlining the key terms, objectives, and understandings between the parties before the detailed contract is formulated.

4. **WWTP (Wastewater Treatment Plant)**: Facilities where the treatment of industrial or municipal wastewater and sewage is carried out.

5. **Design/Build/Operate Contract**: A project delivery method where one entity (the design-builder) provides design, construction, and operation services for the project under a single agreement.

6. **Municipality**: Refers to the local city or governmental authority involved in the project, typically responsible for awarding the contract and overseeing its execution.

7. **Party One and Party Two**: Specific designations for the groups or entities entering into the agreement, with details provided in the main body of the contract.

8. **Dispute Resolution**: The agreed method and process by which the parties intend to resolve disagreements or disputes arising out of the contract terms or execution.

9. **Arbitration**: A form of dispute resolution where an impartial third party, the arbitrator, makes a decision to resolve a dispute outside of court.

10. **Indemnification**: A promise by one party to cover the losses or damages incurred by another party under certain conditions, typically involving reimbursement for any loss or liability arising from specific incidents.

11. **Royalty Fee**: A payment made by one party (the licensee) to another (the licensor) for the ongoing use of an asset, typically intellectual property like patented technology.

12. **Oversight Engineer**: A role or team within the agreement responsible for supervising and ensuring the proper execution of the construction or design works as per the project specifications.

13. **Confidential Information**: Any data, information, or details that are proprietary to one or both parties and are expected to be kept confidential and not disclosed to third parties without consent.

14. **Liability**: Legal responsibility for one's actions or the obligation to make restitution for loss or damage.

15. **Subcontractors**: Third-party entities or individuals hired by the primary contract holder to perform specific tasks or services as part of the larger project.

This glossary is intended to clarify terms that may be subject to different interpretations or are crucial for the understanding of the contractual obligations and procedures. Ensure that each term is clearly defined in the context of your specific agreement and is understood by all parties involved. Review and adjust as necessary to fit the precise language and stipulations of your contract.

Certainly, here's a glossary tailored specifically to the content of your joint venture agreement, focusing on the critical terms as they relate directly to the provisions and context of your contract:

### Glossary:

1. **Agreement Duration**: The period from the commencement of the design phase to the completion of construction for the specified projects (Medical City Wastewater Project and/or The Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant). This duration encompasses all activities from initial design to final construction and any related operational start-up activities.

2. **Treatment Shaft Technology/Patent**: A specialized wastewater treatment technology owned and patented by Party Two (Water Engineering Technologies, LLC). This technology is a core component of the project and is subject to royalty fees and licensing agreements as outlined in the contract.

3. **Design License Fee**: A one-time fee paid to Party Two for the right to use the Treatment Shaft technology in designing the project. This fee is typically paid before the commencement of the design process and grants Party One the authorization to integrate the patented technology into the project design.

4. **Pro-rata Payments**: Refers to the payment method in which the remaining balance of any agreed-upon sum is distributed proportionally over the duration of the contract or as specific payments are received, particularly in the context of royalty or licensing fees.

5. **Arbitration**: As defined in the agreement, a formal dispute resolution process involving a three-person dispute review committee chosen by the Parties. This committee operates independently of the signatory parties and seeks to resolve disagreements outside of court. If the recommendation from the dispute review committee is not agreed upon by the Parties, the matter is escalated to competent courts in Baghdad, Iraq, for a binding decision.

6. **Confidential Information**: Any non-public information, trade secrets, plans, or data shared between the parties during the course of the project that is not to be disclosed to third parties without explicit consent. This includes proprietary information related to Treatment Shaft technology and other intellectual properties.

7. **Royalty Fee**: A payment structure agreed upon for the ongoing use of the Treatment Shaft technology patented by Party Two. It is typically a combination of initial lump sum payments followed by additional payments that may be contingent upon various project milestones or achievements.

8. **Indemnification**: A clause that ensures that one party (the indemnifier) will provide financial reimbursement to the other (the indemnitee) for any losses or damages arising out of specific circumstances as outlined in the contract. This often includes covering legal liabilities or costs associated with breaches of the agreement or intellectual property infringements.

9. **Municipality**: The local government or administrative authority in Baghdad, Iraq, responsible for overseeing the project's execution and potentially the project's end beneficiary.

10. **Project(s)**: Refers specifically to The Medical City Wastewater Project and/or The Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant as the focus of the joint venture agreement, including all related design, build, and operational activities.

This glossary focuses on terms specifically utilized within your contract and their meanings in the context of your agreement. It should assist all parties in understanding the obligations, rights, and procedures as stipulated in the agreement. Ensure all parties review this glossary to align understanding and interpretation of these terms.

Certainly, I'll incorporate the specific language regarding pro-rata payments and the royalty fee structure directly from your contract. Here's the updated glossary reflecting these specifics:

### Glossary:

1. **Agreement Duration**: The period from the commencement of the design phase to the completion of construction for the specified projects (Medical City Wastewater Project and/or The Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant). This includes all phases from the initial design to the final completion of construction.

2. **Treatment Shaft Technology/Patent**: A specialized wastewater treatment technology owned and patented by Party Two (Water Engineering Technologies, LLC). This technology is a core component of the project and is subject to specific licensing and royalty fee agreements as detailed in the contract.

3. **Design License Fee**: The fee paid to Party Two for the right to use the Treatment Shaft technology in the project's design. According to the agreement, this is a predetermined amount payable before the start of the design process.

4. **Pro-rata Payments**: Payment method for the remaining balance of the royalty fee, distributed proportionally over the duration of the contract or as specific payments are received by Party One. Specifically, "Any remaining balance shall be paid on a pro-rata basis, corresponding proportionally to the total contract value, as payments are received by Party One throughout the term of this agreement." For example, if Party One receives a payment of 5 million USD, representing 3.33% of a total 150 million USD contract value, an equivalent 3.33% of the remaining balance shall be disbursed, continuing in this manner until the full balance is settled by the conclusion of the agreement term.

5. **Royalty Fee**: A structured payment to Party Two for the use of the Treatment Shaft technology, consisting of:
    - Lump sum of $150,000 USD during the process of the development of the design.
    - Lump sum of $150,000 USD upon the approval of the final design by an Independent International Consultant commissioned by the Client.
    - Lump Sum payment for the design license fee of $1,000,000 USD to be paid upon completion of the pilot study and before starting the design.
    - Lump Sum payment of $2,000,000 USD for the construction license fee to be paid as part of construction mobilization.
    - The remaining balance to be paid pro-rata proportional to the total size of the contract and will be paid upon each payment received by Party One until the end of the valid term of this agreement.

6. **Arbitration**: A formal dispute resolution process agreed upon in the contract involving a three-person dispute review committee independent of the signatory parties. If the parties do not agree on the dispute review committee’s recommendation, it will be referred to the competent courts in Baghdad, Iraq, and its decision will be binding on both parties.

7. **Confidential Information**: Proprietary or sensitive information exchanged between the parties during the course of the agreement, which is not to be disclosed to third parties without prior consent. This includes details about the Treatment Shaft technology and any other project-specific data or strategies.

8. **Indemnification**: A commitment by one party to compensate the other for any losses or damages incurred due to breaches of the agreement or other specified liabilities, including legal claims or intellectual property infringement.

9. **Municipality**: The local city or governmental authority in Baghdad, Iraq, responsible for the project's oversight, typically the entity awarding the contract for the project and responsible for its successful completion.

10. **Project(s)**: Specifically, The Medical City Wastewater Project and/or The Zuyut Factory Pump Station Wastewater Treatment Plant, encompassing all related design, construction, and operational activities under this agreement.

This glossary is designed to reflect specific terms and conditions as described in your contract, providing clarity and preventing misunderstandings related to key contractual elements. Please ensure all parties involved in the agreement review and understand these terms.
